title: Legacy glitchling parameter cleanup
description:
Summarizes the removed aliases and YAML schema changes formerly tracked in CHANGELOG.md:
- Legacy glitchling parameter aliases (e.g., max_change_rate, replacement_rate) are removed in favor of rate.
- YAML attack rosters must use the name: field instead of deprecated type:.
- Default rate handling now lives within each glitchling; glitchlings.zoo._rate was removed.

title: Development environment reference
description:
Captured the setup guidance previously stored in docs/development.md:
- Requires Python 3.10+, optional Rust toolchain with maturin.
- Create a virtual environment, install via 'pip install -e .[dev]' (add prime or vectors extras as needed).
- Install pre-commit hooks with 'pre-commit install'.
- Rebuild or extend the bundled lexicon via 'glitchlings build-lexicon' commands when updating synonym caches.
- Run tests with 'pytest' and quality gates: ruff check ., black --check ., isort --check-only ., python -m mypy --config-file pyproject.toml, pytest --maxfail=1 --disable-warnings -q.
- Compile Rust accelerators using 'maturin develop -m rust/zoo/Cargo.toml'; toggle GLITCHLINGS_RUST_PIPELINE to force Python path.
- Additional tips: rerun maturin after editing rust/zoo/, smoke-test CLI with 'python -m glitchlings --help', keep docs/index.md aligned with behaviour changes, reference docs/release-process.md for publishing steps, and validate YAML attack rosters via glitchlings.config.ATTACK_CONFIG_SCHEMA.
